intro: Rudgea vallis, commonly known as the valley rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Rudgea vallis is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in forest understories.
